messages.subject: Laurie leaving
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/7/01 11:31:25 PM US Mountain Standard Time, ... I m curious as to why you keep on reading and answering these unschooling messages if some
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/7/01 11:31:25 PM US Mountain Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> I am also free to disagree. But apparently not to say so.
> Laurie
>
I'm curious as to why you keep on reading and answering these unschooling
messages if some part of you doesn't enjoy this? When the Gun talk was going
on (I get a digest version) I read the amount of messages, looked at the
titles and skipped to the ones I wanted to read. That's not to say I didn't
read some of the gun talk, just not all of it. It wasn't such a hot topic
for me, but I thoroughly enjoyed the banter back and forth of the people that
it was an important subject too. I even learned some things about not only
people but guns.

Isn't learning what we are all about?

Dawn

"The people who get on in this world
are people who get up and look for the
circumstances they want, and,
if they can't find them, make them." - George Bernard Shaw

"The only time my education was interrupted was when I was in school."-George
Bernard Shaw
